jobs.title: Senior Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Starbridge is looking for our first Product Manager to join our growing team. This person will work report to our Chief Product Officer and work closely with our Head of Design and Head of Engineering alongside the engineering team to shape the future of the Starbridge product.

This role is massive in scope: on any given day, you may spend a few hours going over technical requirements with the engineering team, then work on our roadmap for the next month, and then finish the day with back to back customer interviews.

What You’ll Do

  • Define and drive feature development on everything from the core user facing screens of Starbridge to deeply technical backend parts of our data infrastructure.

  • Work with our Chief Product Officer to drive and define our product roadmap.

  • Talk to our customers, understand their pain points, and build towards solving them.

  • Build out and analyze product metrics to understand what’s working and what isn’t for our customers.

  • Partner with our Customer Success, Marketing, and GTM teams to structure high impact launches.

You Might Be a Good Fit If You:

  • Have built great products: You ideally have 4+ years of product management experience, preferably with some of that experience at early stage companies.

  • Are obsessed with figuring out the answer: Half of nights, you’re awake in bed because you haven’t quite figured out what the problem is yet. The other half, it’s because you haven’t figured out the perfect solution.

  • Love being a partner: You do what it takes to get the job done and are willing to wear any hat to make that happen. You’ll run customer implementations, act as QA engineer, crunch metrics – whatever it takes to make sure the product succeeds.

  • Understand the technical details: You’re in the technical weeds. You could put together a reasonable first draft of rough t-shirt sizings on technical projects. You can explain what a token is and why they’re used. You can open a browser console log and have a rough idea of what might be going on. You can write decent SQL and aren’t scared of using a terminal.

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: Your impact will be as large as you want it to be; we are an incredibly flat team that rewards high performers very quickly.

  • Autonomy: You’ll have freedom to innovate and iterate alongside the team.

  • Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

  • Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + early-stage equity

  • Company provided Lunch in office everyday

  • Complimentary gym (Chelsea Piers Fitness) membership

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Regular offsites (NYC + global locations)

jobs.title: Founding Account Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Founding Account Manager

At Starbridge, our mission is to catalyze a new era of public‑private partnerships in the $1.5T State, Local, and Education (SLED) market. We build tools that help companies identify early buying signals — from job changes to board meeting mentions — and reach the right person at the right time.

The Opportunity

We’re hiring a Founding Account Manager to own the renewal, expansion, and upsell components of our revenue engine. You’ll be the strategic partner for our enterprise clients, ensuring they maximize value from the Starbridge platform while driving sustainable growth through best-in-class net revenue retention. This role combines executive relationship management with hands-on customer success, making you a critical driver of our scaling B2B SaaS business.

What You’ll Do

  • Own our revenue retention: Drive renewals, expansions, and upsells across our entire customer base with net revenue retention as your north star KPI

  • Lead executive relationships: Serve as the day-to-day strategic partner for enterprise clients, building trust and alignment at the C-suite level

  • Conduct quarterly business reviews: Facilitate strategic sessions that align customer objectives with Starbridge’s platform capabilities and roadmap

  • Partner cross-functionally: Work closely with Customer Success Managers to ensure seamless customer experiences and identify growth opportunities

  • Drive strategic alignment: Ensure our customers’ go-to-market strategies are optimally supported by Starbridge’s evolving platform

Why You’ll Love This Role

  • Founding impact: Shape the customer success and revenue operations playbook at a fast-growing startup

  • Executive presence: Lead strategic conversations with senior leaders in a $1.5T market

  • AI-powered growth: Work at the intersection of artificial intelligence and go-to-market innovation

  • Ownership: Own a critical revenue lever with direct impact on company growth and trajectory

You Might Be a Good Fit If You:

  • Have proven CSM or Account Management success: You’ve owned renewals and upsells in previous roles, ideally at a B2B SaaS company, with a track record of exceeding NRR targets

  • Command executive presence: You can walk into a room of senior executives and lead strategic discussions with confidence and credibility

  • Are fascinated by AI’s GTM impact: You understand how artificial intelligence is transforming sales and marketing, and you’re excited to be part of that evolution

  • Thrive in ambiguity: As a founding hire, you’re comfortable building processes from the ground up and wearing multiple hats

  • Have relevant market experience: Bonus points for experience in government, education, or public sector sales

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: Your impact will be as large as you want it to be; we are an incredibly flat team that rewards high performers very quickly.

  • Autonomy: You’ll have freedom to innovate and iterate alongside the team.

  • Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

  • Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + early-stage equity

  • Company provided Lunch in office everyday

  • Complimentary gym (Chelsea Piers Fitness) membership

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Regular offsites (NYC + global locations)

jobs.title: Technical Recruiter – EMEA (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Starbridge is seeking a Technical Recruiter based in EMEA to help us identify, qualify, and engage world-class talent. As one of our first recruiters outside the U.S., you will play a critical role in shaping our global hiring strategy and ensuring a strong candidate experience across regions and functions.

You will partner with hiring managers to source, screen, and assess candidates across technical and go-to-market roles, and in some cases drive candidates through later-stage interviews. Your work will directly impact our ability to scale with top-tier talent in a competitive market.

If you are energized by fast-paced environments, have a keen eye for technical aptitude, and thrive in high-ownership roles, we’d love to meet you.

Responsibilities & Impact

  • Own candidate screening & qualification: Conduct resume reviews and interviews to assess skills, experience, and culture fit across technical EMEA-based roles.

  • Partner with hiring managers: Collaborate with R&D leadership to define role requirements, interview processes, and success profiles.

  • Drive candidate pipeline in EMEA: Manage inbound applications, referrals, and sourced candidates to ensure steady funnel progression.

  • Support later-stage interviews: Where needed, conduct deeper evaluations (technical or competency-based) to accelerate decision-making.

  • Ensure a world-class candidate experience: Communicate clearly, provide timely feedback, and represent Starbridge’s brand and mission authentically.

  • Streamline recruiting operations: Help implement best practices around tools, workflows, and reporting to improve efficiency.

  • Act as a trusted advisor: Provide market insights on compensation, candidate availability, and recruiting best practices in the EMEA region.

What You Bring

Must Have

  • Exceptional written & verbal communication skills in English.

  • 3+ years experience in recruiting, ideally with a focus on technical roles in high-growth startups or SaaS companies.

  • Demonstrated ability to independently qualify, screen, and progress candidates through hiring processes.

  • Experience working with EMEA talent markets, with sensitivity to local hiring norms and compliance requirements.

  • Strong interviewing skills with the ability to assess both technical and behavioral competencies.

  • High attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and a proactive communication style.

  • Ownership mentality: you thrive in ambiguity, move quickly, and bias toward action.

Nice to Have

  • Experience supporting full-cycle recruiting (from sourcing to closing).

  • Familiarity with modern recruiting platforms and tools (e.g., Ashby, Greenhouse, Gem, Juicebox, etc.).

  • Technical literacy—comfortable discussing software engineering concepts, tools, and stacks at a high level.

  • Prior experience scaling recruiting in early-stage companies.

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: You’ll shape how we build teams across EMEA.

  • Autonomy: You’ll run your process with the freedom to innovate.

  • Trajectory: We’re scaling quickly and see this role growing in scope.

  • Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

  • Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + early-stage equity

  • Flexible remote-first work policy within EMEA

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Regular offsites (NYC + global locations)

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Software Engineer (NYC)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

We are looking for a generalist senior frontend engineer to join our early team in New York City. This role will work closely with our product and design team as well as the rest of our engineering team to build the user-facing aspects of the Starbridge platform. You'll figure out ways to build highly performant, stable frontends that allow us to explain technical concepts to non-technical users and create structures that allow us to build and iterate quickly and be responsive to customer feedback.

You might be a fit if you:

  • Have 7+ years of software engineering experience working on modern web ecosystems.

  • Have 5+ years of experience with React, Typescript, Javascript, RESTful API, CSS, and other front-end technologies.

  • Are a team player who is excited to do what it takes to make the team successful. You're proactive both in how you work and how you communicate.

  • Are comfortable in a work environment that blends sync and async communication and work.

  • Set the highest possible UX and UI bar for the work you do.

  • Understands how code can affect performance and how to measure and optimize the work you do.

  • Are excited to build an in-person culture with us.

Preferably, you also have experience with at least some of the following:

  • Experience as a technical lead making architectural design decisions.

  • Github CI/CD.

After submitting your application, the team reviews your CV and statement of exceptional work. If your application passes this stage, you will be invited to a 20-minute phone interview during which a member of our team will make sure you're a good fit for the role. You will have the opportunity ask questions and learn more about the role as well.

We'll then send you a programming challenge that consists of two parts: LeetCode and SQL. Beyond that step, you will enter the main process, which consists of three interviews:

  1. Experience, theory, and system design.

  2. Live coding.

  3. Product thinking and past work.

Our goal is to finish the process within one week. All interviews will be conducted via Zoom.

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: You’ll play a foundational role in building our product and design culture

  • Autonomy: You’ll have space to experiment, iterate, and influence the roadmap

  • Trajectory: We’re seeing real traction and scaling fast. Revenue is doubling monthly!

  • Team: You’ll work with sharp, low-ego teammates who care deeply about craft and industry

  • Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: Your impact will be as large as you want it to be; we are an incredibly flat team that rewards high performers very quickly.

  • Autonomy: You’ll have freedom to innovate and iterate alongside the team.

  • Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

  • Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + early-stage equity

  • Company provided Lunch in office everyday

  • Complimentary gym (Chelsea Piers Fitness) membership

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Regular offsites (NYC + global locations)

jobs.title: Enterprise Business Development Representative
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Enterprise Business Development Representative | Starbridge

At Starbridge, we're redefining how companies win public sector deals. Our innovative GTM intelligence platform empowers businesses to confidently approach and win contracts in the State, Local, and Education (SLED) market — a $1.5 trillion space ripe for disruption.

We're hiring a Founding Enterprise Business Development Representative to break into our most strategic enterprise accounts. You'll have your own book of business, own a number, and be responsible for generating qualified opportunities within our top-tier accounts.

What You'll Do

  • Own Enterprise Accounts: Manage a defined portfolio of high-value enterprise accounts with a high degree of autonomy over outbound strategy. You'll carry a quota for opportunity creation and pipeline generation.

  • Get Creative: Think outside the box to get in front of sales leadership at our highest priority accounts — dinners, sporting events, hand-delivered packages, personalized campaigns, etc. This role is about finesse, creativity, and grit.

  • Document What Works: As a founding member, you'll help establish the playbook for scaling our enterprise motion.

Why This Role

  • Fast Track to Closing: This is the perfect role for someone who wants to learn enterprise sales, push their comfort zone to grow quickly, and move into a closing role.

  • Real Ownership: You'll have your own accounts, your own number, and the autonomy to execute your strategy.

  • Resources to Win: Budget for creative outreach, from events to customized campaigns.

  • Direct Mentorship: Work directly with sales leadership to accelerate your development.

Who We're Looking For

  • 1-2 years BDR experience required with proven quota attainment

  • High autonomy. We expect people with a high degree of agency. We give them targets and they find a way to deliver

  • Detail-oriented and creative in developing account strategies

  • Personable with ability to build executive relationships

  • Ambitious with clear desire to advance to closing role

  • Bachelor's degree required

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: Your impact will be as large as you want it to be; we are an incredibly flat team that rewards high performers very quickly.

  • Autonomy: You’ll have freedom to innovate and iterate alongside the team.

  • Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

  • Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + early-stage equity

  • Company provided Lunch in office everyday

  • Complimentary gym (Chelsea Piers Fitness) membership

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Regular offsites (NYC + global locations)

jobs.title: Account Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
The Opportunity

We're seeking a dynamic Account Executive to join our rapidly growing team in New York City. This role offers the chance to be a part of a modern GTM team, engage with high-quality leads, and significantly impact Starbridge's growth trajectory.​

What You'll Do

  • Drive Sales Excellence: Manage the sales cycle from discovery to close. Most of your focus will be on closing deals — not prospecting.​ Our Growth and Marketing teams will keep you VERY busy :)

  • Build Strategic Relationships: Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with key decision-makers in the SLED market, positioning Starbridge as a trusted partner.​

  • Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Work closely with our product, marketing, and customer success teams to ensure client satisfaction and inform product development.​

  • Achieve and Exceed Targets: Consistently meet and surpass sales quotas, contributing to the company's overall success.​

Why You'll Love This Role

  • Modern GTM Motion: Our team operates with a cutting-edge GTM approach, leveraging best-in-class tools and intent signals to punch above our weight — meaning you'll close more deals, faster, without endless cold outreach.

  • High-Quality Leads: Benefit from a steady stream of qualified leads, allowing you to focus on closing deals.​ Our AEs are currently taking 2 to 3 new calls per day.

  • Career Growth: Join a fast-paced startup environment with ample opportunities for professional development and advancement.​

  • Collaborative Culture: Be part of a supportive team that values innovation, collaboration, and achieving results.​

Qualifications

  • Proven Sales Experience: Minimum 2 years of successful experience in a closing role, preferably within B2B SaaS.

  • Strong Communication Skills: Exceptional ability to articulate value propositions and negotiate effectively.​

  • Systems Thinking: Successfully building and demoing the Starbridge platform is like putting together a puzzle for your customers. No solutions engineers help here to answer the "tough" questions. The right candidate will be excited about this challenge.

  • Adaptability: Comfortable in a dynamic environment and able to pivot strategies as needed.​

  • Bachelor's Degree: Required; field of study is flexible.​

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: Your impact will be as large as you want it to be; we are an incredibly flat team that rewards high performers very quickly.

  • Autonomy: You’ll have freedom to innovate and iterate alongside the team.

  • Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

  • Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + early-stage equity

  • Company provided Lunch in office everyday

  • Complimentary gym (Chelsea Piers Fitness) membership

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Regular offsites (NYC + global locations)

 - Achieve and Exceed Targets: Consistently meet and surpass sales quotas, contributing to the company's overall success.
   

Why You'll Love This Role

 - Modern GTM Motion: Our team operates with a cutting-edge GTM approach, leveraging best-in-class tools and intent signals to punch above our weight — meaning you'll close more deals, faster, without endless cold outreach.

 - High-Quality Leads: Benefit from a steady stream of qualified leads, allowing you to focus on closing deals. Our AEs are currently taking 2 to 3 new calls per day.

 - Career Growth: Join a fast-paced startup environment with ample opportunities for professional development and advancement.

 - Collaborative Culture: Be part of a supportive team that values innovation, collaboration, and achieving results.
   

Qualifications

 - Proven Sales Experience: Minimum 2 years of successful experience in a closing role, preferably within B2B SaaS.

 - Strong Communication Skills: Exceptional ability to articulate value propositions and negotiate effectively.

 - Systems Thinking: Successfully building and demoing the Starbridge platform is like putting together a puzzle for your customers. No solutions engineers help here to answer the "tough" questions. The right candidate will be excited about this challenge.

 - Adaptability: Comfortable in a dynamic environment and able to pivot strategies as needed.

 - Bachelor's Degree: Required; field of study is flexible.
   

Why Join Starbridge

 - Ownership: Your impact will be as large as you want it to be; we are an incredibly flat team that rewards high performers very quickly.

 - Autonomy: You’ll have freedom to innovate and iterate alongside the team.

 - Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

 - Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence.

Benefits include:

 - Competitive salary + early-stage equity

 - Company provided Lunch in office everyday

 - Complimentary gym (Chelsea Piers Fitness) membership

 - Unlimited PTO

 - Regular offsites (NYC + global locations)

jobs.title: Customer Solutions Architect
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We’re hiring a Customer Solutions Architect to partner with our customers on all things functionl and technical to drive adoption & value realization from their investment in Starbridge. This is a hands-on, high-impact role where you’ll define processes, drive customer adoption, and ensure long-term success. You’ll work closely with the CS, Product, and Sales organizations, reporting directly to the Chief Product Officer, with visibility across the entire company. If you thrive in fast-moving environments, enjoy solving complex problems, and want to make a direct impact on customer delight and retention, this role is for you.

Key Responsibilities

  • Onboard & Train - Own customer onboarding and training to achieve high adoption. Develop and refine training materials as you scale.

  • Be the Voice of the Customer - Gather feedback, advocate for feature improvements, and work with the product team to enhance the customer experience.

  • Scale Support - Be the frontline for customer inquiries, and continuously improve processes through automation and documentation.

  • Monitor & Optimize - Define and track customer health metrics, proactively addressing risks and opportunities.

  • Drive Renewals & Expansion - Build deep relationships with customers, identify growth opportunities, and increase platform utilization.

This is the role for you if:

  • You want to get your hands dirty making our early customers our greatest advocates as well as build the structures around how we scale the overall Customer Success function as we scale.

  • Problems make you angry and solutions bring you joy - you’re the type of person who will do whatever it takes to solve a problem, no matter how big or small. If you’ve sent a dozen cold emails or taught yourself basic Python to solve a problem in the past, you’re this person. 

  • You’re excited to be exposed to and work alongside every function of a fast paced, quickly growing startup, from engineering to GTM.

Skills Knowledge And Expertise

  • 3+ years in Customer Success, Solutions Engineering/Consulting, Deployments or Implementation, Account Management, or a related role in B2B SaaS. If you’re coming from a different background and think you’d be a great fit, tell us why!

  • Process Builder - You’ve built systems from scratch and thrive in ambiguity.

  • Data Driven - Comfortable building process around, tracking, and making decisions based on customer data.

  • Customer Centric - A natural relationship builder who can drive adoption and retention.

  • Technical Aptitude - Able to understand and explain a data-driven SaaS platform. 

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: Your impact will be as large as you want it to be; we are an incredibly flat team that rewards high performers very quickly.

  • Autonomy: You’ll have freedom to innovate and iterate alongside the team.

  • Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

  • Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + early-stage equity

  • Company provided Lunch in office everyday

  • Complimentary gym (Chelsea Piers Fitness) membership

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Regular offsites (NYC + global locations)

jobs.title: Founding GTM Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
The Opportunity

We’re hiring a GTM Engineer to own our scaled outbound motion. You’ll work closely with the Head of Growth to build and optimize workflows that drive personalized, high‑volume outreach using modern GTM tools. This role blends technical implementation with creative problem‑solving to generate pipeline in a large, underpenetrated market.

What You’ll Do

  • Build and maintain outbound workflows using automation and enrichment tools

  • Operationalize buying signals (job changes, competitor activity, board minutes, etc.) into campaigns

  • Experiment with new tools and processes to improve results

Why You’ll Love This Role

  • Large TAM: Work in a $1.5T market with huge growth potential

  • Rich Intent Data: Leverage evergreen buying signals for high‑value outreach

  • Impact: Own a critical growth lever at a scaling B2B SaaS company

Qualifications

  • 1–3 years managing GTM workflows at a B2B SaaS company

  • Experience with tools like Clay, Smartlead, HeyReach, or n8n

  • Ability to integrate systems and create no‑code/low‑code automations

  • Familiarity with scaled outbound strategies and deliverability best practices

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: Your impact will be as large as you want it to be; we are an incredibly flat team that rewards high performers very quickly.

  • Autonomy: You’ll have freedom to innovate and iterate alongside the team.

  • Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Software Engineer - Java/Kotlin (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

We are looking for a remote generalist senior backend engineer with experience in Java (and preferably Kotlin) to join our early team to build our product from zero to one. Your role will include projects working with other team members including building integrations into enterprise systems, scraping, contributing to systems to allows users to use LLMs to generate sales insights at scale, and scrape, processing & deriving insights from millions of public documents.

You might be a fit if you:

  • Are a senior developer with Enterprise B2B SaaS experience or Big data processing experience in the JVM ecosystem and ideally Kotlin.

  • Are excited to roll up your sleeves and work in all parts of the backend and have experience working in small teams & startups. Ideally have experience working in a fast-growing startup.

  • Ideally have experience with the following stack:

    • Kotlin (BE)

    • GCP

    • Google Cloud SQL for PostgreSQL

    • Firebase

    • Python

  • Have experience with some of the following (not required):

    • Natural Language Generation

    • Enterprise API integrations

    • Prompt Engineering

    • Large Scale Web Scraping & Parsing

  • Are fluent in written and spoken English

Interview Process

After submitting your application, the team reviews your CV and statement of exceptional work. If your application passes this stage, you will be invited to a 20-minute phone interview during which a member of our team will make sure you're a good fit for the role. You will have the opportunity ask questions and learn more about the role as well.

We'll then send you a programming challenge that consists of two parts: LeetCode and SQL. Beyond that step, you will enter the main process, which consists of three interviews:

  1. System design exercise hands-on.

  2. Live coding in Java/Kotlin.

  3. Product thinking and past work.

Our goal is to finish the process within one week. All interviews will be conducted via Google Meet.

jobs.title: Product Marketing Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Starbridge is seeking a Product Marketing Manager to help us define and deliver the narrative that powers our go-to-market strategy. You’ll be the first dedicated PMM on the team, stepping in at a moment of rapid growth and expansion across new verticals, product lines, and customer segments.

You’ll work cross-functionally across marketing, product, and sales to shape our messaging, competitive positioning, and enablement materials. Your work will directly impact how we show up in the market, how our sales team tells the story, and how customers understand the value of our platform.

If you’re a strategic thinker, strong writer, and energized by high-ownership, cross-functional work—we’d love to meet you.

Responsibilities & Impact

Own positioning & messaging: Craft clear, compelling messaging for our platform across website copy, decks, one-pagers, and outbound materials.

Support new vertical launches: Work with product and sales to build GTM strategies for new segments like Parks & Rec, HVAC, and the Federal space.

Drive sales enablement: Partner with the sales team to create materials that help close deals—demo decks, battlecards, talk tracks, and more.

Lead competitive intelligence: Build and maintain a structured view of our competitors, helping us sharpen differentiation and inform roadmap priorities.

Manage cross-functional inputs: Act as a central point of coordination between product, marketing, and sales to ensure alignment across teams.

Define the Starbridge narrative: Own the story that ties everything together from positioning to product to customer outcomes.

What You Bring

Must Have

  • 2–5 years of experience in product marketing at a high-growth B2B SaaS company, or background in management consulting + startup ops

  • Exceptional writing and communication skills; comfortable owning customer-facing messaging

  • Demonstrated ability to manage cross-functional projects with multiple stakeholders

  • Strategic thinker who thrives in ambiguity and can quickly synthesize inputs into action

  • Empathy for the sales team and a passion for building materials that actually get used

  • High-ownership mindset and strong execution skills—comfortable juggling competing priorities

Nice to Have

  • Experience marketing to regulated industries or public sector clients

  • Prior ownership of sales enablement programs or competitive intelligence initiatives

  • Familiarity with tools like HubSpot, Webflow, and Notion

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: Your impact will be as large as you want it to be; we are an incredibly flat team that rewards high performers very quickly.

  • Autonomy: You’ll have freedom to innovate and iterate alongside the team.

  • Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

  • Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + early-stage equity

  • Company provided Lunch in office everyday

  • Complimentary gym (Chelsea Piers Fitness) membership

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Regular offsites (NYC + global locations)

jobs.title: Event Marketing Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We’re hiring a Field & Event Marketing Manager to design bold event activations that put Starbridge in the center of the public sector GTM conversation. Starbridge is the GTM system-of-action for public sector sellers. Events and field experiences have been a growth engine for us, now we need someone who can push the creativity, scale, and impact even further.

This role is part builder, part strategist. One week you’re designing an in-booth product activation at a major conference. The next, you’re orchestrating an executive dinner series or a city-by-city roadshow. You’ll create memorable, product-driven experiences that stand out, drive pipeline, and help sellers win.

What you’ll do:

  • Create scrappy, high-impact activations. You’ll dream up ways to showcase product in the field: live demos, interactive stations, creative swag, or surprise moments that make people stop and talk.

  • Run events end-to-end. From trade shows to our first user conference next year, you’ll handle strategy, logistics, and execution, rolling up your sleeves to make things happen.

  • Test new plays. Pilot roadshows, co-hosted activations, or unconventional ideas that break through the noise and quickly double down on what works.

  • Build the field engine. Start scrappy, then turn experiments into repeatable playbooks we can scale with partners, vendors, and tech.

  • Work hand-in-hand with sales and product. Ensure every activation is tightly connected to pipeline and that our product shines in the spotlight.

You might be a fit if:

  • You’ve got 2+ years of experience running field or event marketing at an early/mid-stage B2B SaaS company.

  • You know how to tie creativity to outcomes: pipeline, brand buzz, customer love.

  • You’re not afraid to experiment and iterate.

  • You're willing to be on the road at minimum once a month.

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: Your impact will be as large as you want it to be; we are an incredibly flat team that rewards high performers very quickly.

  • Autonomy: You’ll have freedom to innovate and iterate alongside the team.

  • Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

  • Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + early-stage equity

  • Company provided Lunch in office everyday

  • Complimentary gym (Chelsea Piers Fitness) membership

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Regular offsites (NYC + global locations)

jobs.title: Senior Backend Software Engineer - Java/Kotlin (NYC)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

We are looking for a remote generalist senior backend engineer with experience in Java (and preferably Kotlin) to join our early team to build our product from zero to one. The role is based in downtown Manhattan, New York City.

Your role will include projects working with other team members including building integrations into enterprise systems, scraping, contributing to systems to allows users to use LLMs to generate sales insights at scale, and scrape, processing & deriving insights from millions of public documents.

You might be a fit if you:

  • Are a senior developer with Enterprise B2B SaaS experience or Big data processing experience in the JVM ecosystem and ideally Kotlin.

  • Are excited to roll up your sleeves and work in all parts of the backend and have experience working in small teams & startups. Ideally have experience working in a fast-growing startup.

  • Ideally experience with the following stack:

    • Kotlin (BE)

    • GCP

    • Google Cloud SQL for PostgreSQL

    • Firebase

    • Python

  • Have experience with some of the following (not required):

    • Natural Language Generation

    • Enterprise API integrations

    • Prompt Engineering

    • Large Scale Web Scraping & Parsing

Interview Process

After submitting your application, the team reviews your CV and statement of exceptional work. If your application passes this stage, you will be invited to a 30-minute phone interview during which a member of our team will make sure you're a good fit for the role. You will have the opportunity ask questions and learn more about the role as well.

We'll then send you a programming challenge that consists of two parts: LeetCode and SQL. Beyond that step, you will enter the main process, which consists of three interviews:

  1. System design exercise hands-on.

  2. Live coding in Java/Kotlin.

  3. Product thinking and past work.

Our goal is to finish the process within one week. All interviews will be conducted via Google Meet.

jobs.title: VP, Customer Success
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We’re looking for a VP of Customer Success to define and lead our customer success strategy as we enter our next stage of growth. You’ll own the end-to-end customer journey, managing a high velocity CS team while building scalable systems that make adoption predictable and measurable.

Your goal: make Starbridge best-in-class in implementation speed, value realization, and ongoing adoption. You’ll ensure that customers see measurable outcomes fast, continue realizing new value as our platform evolves, and feel supported through every phase of growth and every new use case.

Responsibilities & Impact

  • Own the customer lifecycle end-to-end ensuring every customer achieves measurable success with Starbridge.

  • Build and lead the Customer Success organization, managing and mentoring a high-performing team of technical CSMs who deliver white-glove engagement and technical guidance.

  • Develop scalable processes for onboarding, training, proactive adoption, and support, preserving Starbridge’s hands-on experience while enabling efficient growth.

  • Design frameworks for best-in-class implementation, ensuring customers realize time-to-value quickly and consistently.

  • Create the frameworks for a scalable support function that ensures customers get timely, high-quality help as we grow.

  • Ensure ongoing value realization, helping customers continuously identify and adopt features that align with their evolving goals.

  • Operationalize customer health and success metrics to predict adoption, surface risks early, and make outcomes measurable and repeatable.

  • Partner cross-functionally with Product and Sales to ensure feedback loops are tight and customer insights drive roadmap and GTM priorities.

  • Serve as executive sponsor for key enterprise relationships, bringing both technical fluency and business acumen to strategic conversations.

  • Implement systems and tools to manage customer data, track engagement, and automate key workflows.

  • Build customer community to drive network effects and evangelism within our customer base.

What You Bring

Must Have

  • 10+ years of experience in Customer Success within high-growth B2B SaaS, including 4+ years managing teams.

  • Proven success scaling a CS organization from early-stage (Series A–B) to growth stage while maintaining deep customer intimacy.

  • Strong operator’s mindset: you design systems and processes that make adoption predictable and repeatable.

  • Experience implementing customer health models, adoption metrics, and success plans across varied customer segments.

  • Comfort engaging at both strategic and tactical levels: you can jump into a customer Slack channel one day and present retention forecasts to the board the next.

  • Excellent communication, leadership, and relationship-building skills: you inspire trust internally and externally.

  • Empathy and a true customer-obsessed mindset — you see every decision through the lens of the customer journey.

Nice to Have

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We’re looking for a Senior Product Designer to join as one of our earliest design hires and help define the future of Starbridge’s product and design practice. In this role, you’ll own complex, end-to-end design initiatives, from discovery through delivery, all while shaping our growing component library and design system for long-term scale.

You’ll collaborate directly with our Chief Product Officer, Head of Design, and engineering leadership to translate intricate GTM and public sector workflows into elegant, intuitive product experiences that drive measurable impact.

As a senior designer, you’ll influence not only what we build, but how we build and raise the bar for craft. Our founder brings deep domain expertise, having built and sold a company in the same space, so you’ll be partnering with leaders who value and champion design from day one.

If you’re motivated by high ownership, love working at the intersection of complex data and usability, and want to leave your fingerprint on both the product and the company culture, this is a rare opportunity to do your most impactful work.

What You’ll Do

  • Design thoughtful, data-rich experiences for sales and operations teams navigating public sector workflows

  • Drive the evolution of the Starbridge Design System, ensuring scalability, consistency, and exceptional usability

  • Turn ambiguity and complex requirements into clear, approachable designs, balancing user needs with business priorities

  • Partner cross-functionally to shape product vision and roadmap, not just execute on it

You Might Be a Good Fit If You:

  • Have 5+ years of experience designing digital products, with significant experience in B2B SaaS, GTM, or complex enterprise tools

  • Have a track record of driving large, multi-quarter design initiatives from concept to launch

  • Are adept at simplifying complexity without sacrificing power or flexibility

  • Bring deep experience building and scaling design systems that support rapid product growth

  • Thrive in high-ownership environments where you influence both product strategy and design execution

  • Are a strong systems thinker with a sharp eye for detail, accessibility, and polish

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: Your impact will be as large as you want it to be; we are an incredibly flat team that rewards high performers very quickly.

  • Autonomy: You’ll have freedom to innovate and iterate alongside the team.

  • Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

  • Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + early-stage equity

  • Company provided Lunch in office everyday

  • Complimentary gym (Chelsea Piers Fitness) membership

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Regular offsites (NYC + global locations)

jobs.title: Recruiter
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Starbridge is seeking a Recruiter based in NYC to help us identify, qualify, and engage world-class talent as we scale. You will play a critical role in shaping our global hiring strategy and ensuring a strong candidate experience across regions and functions.

You will partner with hiring managers to source, screen, and assess candidates across technical and go-to-market roles, and in some cases drive candidates through later-stage interviews. Your work will directly impact our ability to scale with top-tier talent in a competitive market.

If you are energized by fast-paced environments, have a keen eye for technical aptitude, and thrive in high-ownership roles, we’d love to meet you.

Responsibilities & Impact

  • Own candidate screening & qualification: Conduct resume reviews and interviews to assess skills, experience, and culture fit across technical and business roles, largely in the United States.

  • Partner with hiring managers: Collaborate with leadership to define role requirements, interview processes, and success profiles.

  • Drive candidate pipeline in US/NYC: Manage inbound applications, referrals, and sourced candidates to ensure steady funnel progression.

  • Support later-stage interviews: Where needed, conduct deeper evaluations (technical or competency-based) to accelerate decision-making.

  • Ensure a world-class candidate experience: Communicate clearly, provide timely feedback, and represent Starbridge’s brand and mission authentically.

  • Act as a trusted advisor: Provide market insights on compensation, candidate availability, and recruiting best practices in the EMEA region.

What You Bring

Must Have

  • Exceptional written & verbal communication skills

  • 3+ years experience in recruiting in a high-growth, SaaS environment.

  • Demonstrated ability to independently qualify, screen, and progress candidates through hiring processes.

  • Strong interviewing skills with the ability to assess both technical and behavioral competencies.

  • High attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and a proactive communication style.

  • Ownership mentality: you thrive in ambiguity, move quickly, and bias toward action.

Nice to Have

  • Familiarity with modern recruiting platforms and tools (e.g., Ashby, Greenhouse, Gem, Juicebox, etc.).

  • Technical literacy—comfortable discussing software engineering concepts, tools, and stacks at a high level.

  • Prior experience scaling recruiting in early-stage companies.

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: Your impact will be as large as you want it to be; we are an incredibly flat team that rewards high performers very quickly.

  • Autonomy: You’ll have freedom to innovate and iterate alongside the team.

  • Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

  • Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + early-stage equity

  • Company provided Lunch in office everyday

  • Complimentary gym (Chelsea Piers Fitness) membership

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Regular offsites (NYC + global locations)

jobs.title: VP, Finance
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Starbridge is seeking a dynamic Finance VP to own and scale all aspects of our financial operations. This role is critical in driving financial discipline, healthy growth, and strategic foresight as we scale rapidly.

You will own budgeting, payroll, tax compliance, accounting, and FP&A more broadly, while partnering cross-functionally to provide business insights and operational leverage as needed.

If you are passionate about building in the AI space, thrive in ambiguity, and veer toward high-ownership environments, we’d love to meet you.

Responsibilities & Impact

  • Own design & execution of all core finance functions: payroll, bookkeeping, AP/AR/Collections, tax compliance, month-end close, audit readiness, investor reporting, etc.

  • Partner with leadership on financial planning, budgeting, and headcount forecasting to ensure alignment with company goals.

  • Lead FP&A function, including rolling forecasts, variance analyses, and performance insights.

  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reporting packages that track key metrics (e.g., burn, runway, ARR, LTV/CAC, gross margin, etc.) and power board and investor updates.

  • Manage and evolve internal financial systems (e.g., QuickBooks, Bill.com, Expensify, etc.), driving automation where possible and reducing manual overhead.

  • Build and maintain dynamic financial models and scenario analyses to support decision-making around growth, pricing, hiring, and capital allocation.

  • Collaborate closely with Sales, RevOps, and GTM leadership to ensure accuracy in revenue recognition and commission plans.

  • Ensure tax and regulatory compliance across jurisdictions; liaise with external tax and accounting partners as needed.

  • Implement and uphold internal controls, compliance processes, and financial best practices.

What You Bring

Must Have

  • 6+ years experience in finance and/or FP&A roles within high-growth B2B SaaS, ideally including time at Series A–B stage companies.

  • Demonstrated exemplary ownership of FP&A, accounting, payroll, and compliance at an executive or leadership level.

  • Mastery of Excelfor modeling and analysis; strong experience creating dashboards and board-ready materials–you’re a self-proclaimed Excel Wizard.

  • Exceptional attention to detail, combined with strategic thinking and an ability to translate numbers into action. You thrive in ambiguity and bank on ownership.

  • Strong grasp of SaaS metrics and finance concepts (e.g., deferred revenue, GAAP vs cash, cohort analysis, gross margin, etc.)

  • Excellent project management and cross-functional collaboration skills—you’re extremely self-directed and thrive in a fast-moving, resource-constrained environments

  • Deep familiarity with financial tools and systems (QuickBooks, Gusto, Bill.com, Carta, etc.).

  • Ownership mentality: you have a deep bias towards action.

Nice to Have

  • CPA or MBA credentials

  • 2+ years in investment banking, private equity, or equivalent.

  • Experience preparing for or supporting a fundraise, due diligence, or M&A process

  • Experience standing up or managing finance systems integrations or ERP implementations

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: Your impact will be as large as you want it to be; we are an incredibly flat team that rewards high performers very quickly.

  • Autonomy: You’ll have freedom to innovate and iterate alongside the team.

  • Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

  • Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + early-stage equity

  • Company provided Lunch in office everyday

  • Complimentary gym (Chelsea Piers Fitness) membership

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Regular offsites (NYC + global locations)

jobs.title: Recruiting Automation & AI Program Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Starbridge is growing at a very high velocity: we’ve grown from 0 to almost 200 enterprise customers in the last 6 months. We're seeking a recruiting automation and operations engineer to help us build our team from 20 to 60 rapidly while maintaining an incredibly high talent bar.

You’ll partner with our Head of Recruiting, COO, and hiring managers to build the infrastructure, automations, and workflows that power Starbridge’s talent engine. Your work will directly shape how quickly and intelligently we scale our team—turning recruiting into an AI-first, data-driven, and deeply efficient function.

If you thrive in fast-paced environments, love building systems that make people’s work simpler and smarter, and want to build the future of recruiting—we’d love to meet you.

Responsibilities & Impact

  • Own recruiting systems & automation roadmap: Design and execute the automation and AI roadmap across Ashby, Juicebox, Clay, N8N, and other connected tools to drive mass, scaled and personalized outbound to connect with candidates and drive a high velocity, seamless downstream experience for them.

  • Being an AI-first, experimentation wizard: Run bets with across new tools channels, messaging, and agents, measure ROI, and decide when to expand or sunset.

  • Making our recruiting data-driven: Testing & integrating additional third-party data sources such as Kaggle, Github etc., to inform to stack rank potential candidates.

  • Streamline workflows across the funnel: Optimize how candidates move through sourcing, screening, scheduling, and offers—reducing turnaround time and improving recruiter leverage.

  • Measure and report impact: Define & track metrics to help us optimize the recruiting function from end-to-end.

  • Recruiting and candidates are your customers: Ensure new tools and automations feel intuitive, maintain data integrity and an exceptional candidate experience, and actually make recruiters’ lives easier.

What You Bring

Must Have

  • 5+ years in Recruiting Operations, Business/Revenue Operations, People Systems, or adjacent roles in high-growth SaaS or startup environments.

  • Demonstrated ability to design and implement sophisticated automations across tools like Ashby, Juicebox, Zapier, N8N, etc.

  • Hands-on builder mindset—you’re comfortable scripting, connecting APIs, and experimenting quickly; you're a vibe coding savant.

  • Strong analytical chops; you use data to make and defend process decisions.

Nice to Have

  • Familiarity with BI or SQL tools (Snowflake, Tableau, or similar).

  • Experience integrating AI tools (ChatGPT, Juicebox, etc.) into recruiting workflows.

  • Prior experience standing up recruiting systems from scratch in early-stage companies.

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: Your impact will be as large as you want it to be; we are an incredibly flat team that rewards high performers very quickly.

  • Autonomy: You’ll have freedom to innovate and iterate alongside the team.

  • Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

  • Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + early-stage equity

  • Company provided Lunch in office everyday

  • Complimentary gym (Chelsea Piers Fitness) membership

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Regular offsites (NYC + global locations)

jobs.title: Executive Assistant to the CEO
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Starbridge is growing at breakneck speed — from 0 to nearly 200 enterprise customers in just six months. We’re seeking an Executive Assistant to our CEO who can bring focus, structure, and calm to the energy of rapid growth.

You’ll be the trusted partner who keeps the CEO operating at peak performance — staying two steps ahead, turning chaos into clarity, and ensuring priorities move forward without friction. This role blends sharp operational judgment with warmth and discretion; it’s for someone who thrives on being indispensable in a fast-moving environment.

This is not a traditional administrative job. You’ll serve as the CEO’s right hand and a key connective tissue across the company — ensuring communication flows, initiatives stay on track, and the day-to-day runs with precision.

If you’re highly organized, resourceful, and energized by making complex operations look effortless, we’d love to meet you.

Responsibilities & Impact

  • Be the CEO’s right hand: Anticipate needs, manage time strategically, and create leverage through exceptional organization, prioritization, and follow-through.

  • Own complex calendars with precision: Balance shifting priorities, coordinate across multiple time zones, and ensure every meeting has clear context and preparation.

  • Serve as the central point of communication: Represent the CEO with professionalism and clarity in all interactions — both internal and external.

  • Master travel logistics: Craft seamless itineraries that handle every detail — from flights and lodging to on-the-ground coordination and backup plans.

  • Build and maintain order: Develop lightweight systems to track action items, meeting notes, and cross-functional priorities so nothing is overlooked.

  • Drive special initiatives: Take ownership of one-off projects — operational, cultural, or strategic — and see them through to completion.

  • Support personal and ad hoc needs: Handle select personal logistics and administrative tasks that allow the CEO to focus on scaling the business.

  • Enable great experiences: Help plan team events, leadership offsites, and key company moments with care and excellence.

What You Bring

Must Have

  • 5+ years of experience supporting a senior executive, founder, or CEO in a fast-paced, high-growth environment (startup or tech strongly preferred).

  • Deep pride in being an Executive Assistant — you view the role as mission-critical, not support.

  • Exceptional organizational instincts; you naturally bring order to moving parts.

  • Superb written and verbal communication skills.

  • Ability to juggle competing priorities while remaining composed and proactive.

  • Fluency with modern productivity tools (Notion, Slack, Google Workspace, Superhuman, Airtable, etc.).

  • Comfort working 5 days in-office in NYC — you thrive on proximity, context, and real-time collaboration.

Nice to Have

  • Experience in venture-backed SaaS or high-growth tech.

  • Familiarity with AI tools and workflow automation.

  • Background in operations, project management, or chief-of-staff responsibilities.

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: Your impact will be as large as you want it to be; we are an incredibly flat team that rewards high performers very quickly.

  • Autonomy: You’ll have freedom to innovate and iterate alongside the team.

  • Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

  • Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + early-stage equity

  • Company provided Lunch in office everyday

  • Complimentary gym (Chelsea Piers Fitness) membership

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Regular offsites (NYC + global locations)

jobs.title: Partnerships Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We’re looking for a Partnerships Lead to build and scale our partner ecosystem. You’ll define how Starbridge builds a community of referral, implementation, and VC/PE partners, owning the end-to-end lifecycle from sourcing and structuring to enablement and long-term growth.

This is a 0→1 role with executive visibility across GTM, Marketing, and Product. Your goal: turn partnership into a repeatable, high-impact growth motion.

What You’ll Do

Partner Sourcing & Activation (33%)

  • Identify & source high-fit partners, including GTM agencies, consultants, and VC/PE firms.

  • Own and scale partner activation end-to-end: from discovery → diligence → negotiation → launch → growth.

Partner Management (33%)

  • Build scalable systems for onboarding, enablement, and performance tracking.

  • Create partner sales collateral: case studies, technical decks, and resources that help partners sell and implement confidently.

  • Develop co-marketing campaigns, partner spotlights, and launch playbooks that drive adoption and awareness.

Ecosystem Strategy (33%)

  • Design and own future certification programs

  • Establish incentive structures and tiering for high-performing partners.

  • Collect feedback and insights from partners to inform Product and GTM strategy.

  • Track pipeline, attribution, and ROI across partner types.

What You Bring

  • 2–6 years in partnerships or business development (preferably SaaS or GTM tech).

  • Experience launching or scaling a partner program from the ground up.

  • Strong relationship-builder with an instinct for aligning incentives and driving mutual success.

  • Excellent communicator with operational rigor. You can negotiate, enable, and analyze in equal measure.

  • (Bonus) Familiarity with public-sector or vertical SaaS markets.

Why Join Starbridge

  • Ownership: Your impact will be as large as you want it to be; we are an incredibly flat team that rewards high performers very quickly.

  • Autonomy: You’ll have freedom to innovate and iterate alongside the team.

  • Team: Work alongside sharp, collaborative colleagues who value craft and execution.

  • Mission: Help modern companies sell into a $1.5T public sector with better intelligence.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary + early-stage equity

  • Company provided Lunch in office everyday

  • Complimentary gym (Chelsea Piers Fitness) membership

  • Unlimited PTO

  • Regular offsites (NYC + global locations)

jobs.title: AI Engineer (NYC)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Your responsibilities

  • Collaborate closely with our team as we productize new AI-powered capabilities: such as AI proposal writing & search experiences.

  • Evaluate the performance of AI models (we will work with models from OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini) & systems through rigorous testing and experimentation.

  • Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning research, and proactively suggest improvements to enhance our generative AI capabilities.

  • Implement strong testing and CI/CD practices that help us move with confidence in our AI system development

⭐️ Is this you?

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, related field, or equivalent experience

  • High level of coding proficiency using Python

  • 5+ years of professional experience in software engineering, AI/ML development including:

  • Proficiency with production software (Python) and systems design

  • Machine learning algorithms and model development techniques

  • ML lifecycle tools like MLflow, dvc, weights & biases

  • Cloud deployment of ML systems

  • Professional experience with LLMs and large-scale models

  • Very strong software engineering skills with a track record of building scalable, distributed product machine learning systems

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

  • Ability to communicate complex ideas and concepts effectively

  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience building scalable applications with LLMs, using frameworks such as LangChain, LlamaIndex, Hugging Face, etc

  • Depth of knowledge with RAG implementation and improvements
